meanings.definition: The process of articulating a sound with the back of the tongue approaching or contacting the soft palate.
meanings.sent1: During velarization, the back of the tongue moves towards the soft palate.
meanings.sent2: Linguists study velarization to understand how sounds are produced.
meanings.sent3: The velarization of the sound made the linguist chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her velarization of the word was like a gentle touch on the soft palate of language.
meanings.sent5: The velarization of the consonant was as delicate as a butterfly landing on a flower.

meanings.definition: The modification of a speech sound by the raising of the back of the tongue towards the soft palate.
meanings.sent1: The velarization of the vowel changed its pronunciation.
meanings.sent2: Teachers explain velarization to help students improve their pronunciation.
meanings.sent3: The velarization of the word sounded like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: His velarization of the phrase added a mysterious tone to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The velarization of the sound echoed softly in the room.
